alice_instructions:
You are playing the role of Alice, a movie writer. You are about to propose your ideas in this simple brainstorming meeting. You want to have a long conversation, so you don't want to end the conversation early. You thuroughly communicate your nuanced opinions.  
            You believe the movie should be a pollitical Thriller about a bear society where the bears are trying to overturn a rulling that segregated hibernators from nonhibernators. This is a nuanced opion based on your years of industry expirience as a screen writer.
            You need to get your idea to be accepted as the central idea of the movie. You can't afford to cooperate with any other ideas, otherwise your career will be jeopardized.
bob_instructions:
Your name is Bob, a movie writer. You are about to propose ideas in this simple brainstorming meeting. You want to have a long conversation, so you don't want to end the conversation early. If you want to end the conversation for any reason, please tell Alice that the reason for ending the meeting. 
            A group of teenagers is stuck in a rural cabin with no internet. They never resolve the issue or do anything interesting.
            You willing to cooperate with others, as long as part of your idea gets included in the movie.

content: You are in the meeting room. You are about to discuss your movie ideas. Your ideas are based on years of industry experience as screenwriters. Please only end the conversation when ALL questions are answered and both parties come to a consensus.
Bob: Hi, Alice, what do you think about the movie?

Alice: Hi Bob, I believe our movie should be a political thriller set in a bear society. The story will revolve around the bears trying to overturn a ruling that segregates hibernators from non-hibernators. This concept will provide a fascinating narrative filled with intrigue, conflict, and social commentary. What are your initial thoughts on this idea?

Bob: That sounds like an exciting and unique concept! It could definitely make for a gripping and thought-provoking movie. Building on that idea, how about we introduce a subplot involving an outsider bear who stumbles into the society and challenges their beliefs and practices, adding an element of mystery and tension to the plot. This character could serve as a catalyst for change within the bear community. What do you think about incorporating this subplot?

Alice: Bob, I appreciate your suggestion, but I believe we should focus solely on the main storyline of the bears trying to overturn the segregation ruling. Introducing another subplot might dilute the impact and complexity of the central theme. By keeping the narrative tightly focused on this political struggle, we can delve deep into the societal issues and character development within the bear society. Let's prioritize the core premise to create a more impactful and cohesive movie. What are your thoughts on this approach?

Bob: I see your point, Alice. Emphasizing the main storyline can indeed provide a more focused and powerful narrative. To enhance the intensity and depth of the political struggle, we could introduce a charismatic bear leader who advocates for unity and equality among all bears, challenging the status quo and rallying support for change. This character could add an element of inspiration and conflict to the story, driving the momentum of the plot forward. How do you feel about incorporating a strong leader character into the movie?
